turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: He's through fighting.  Look at him.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I don't care.  Hank.  End it.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Get him onto shore.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: He heeds a tourniquet.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: Well...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: You wanna ride in my truck?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: You sure?  I don't mind...

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: No, I actually <u>want</u> to stay for a little while.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: If I'm ever in New York...

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Y'know, if we didn't live in separate worlds and...

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: But we do.  Hey, we'll always have Maine.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: It was... something meeting you.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: Likewise.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: Different worlds, Jack.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Yeah, I thought about that as I was driving... and... I haven't found somebody in my world.  You found anyone in yours?

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: So I was thinking... maybe if I met anybody in <u>my</u> world who was good for <u>you</u> and if you know somebody in New York good for me, we could fix each other up.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: You think?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Worth a try.  We don't wanna be alone forever, do we?

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: Probably not.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: That was... y'know if the guy asks me can she kiss, now I'll be able to tell him if you can.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: Good thinking.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: We set?

turns.speaker: KEOUGH
turns.text: Ready.  A museum in New York sent us some additional back up.

turns.speaker: KEOUGH
turns.text: I'm ready when you are.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Let's go.

turns.speaker: KEOUGH
turns.text: Half mile up, there's a clearing.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: You gonna dig up that lady's husband?

turns.speaker: KEOUGH
turns.text: I'll call the coroner.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: What's that?

turns.speaker: KEOUGH
turns.text: White perch.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Are they feeding?

turns.speaker: KEOUGH
turns.text: Doesn't <u>look</u> like it.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: They look like they're jumping.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Hank.  The little cannon you brought, get it.  Guard the shoreline.  Otherwise, we're done. We made the I.D., our job is finished.

turns.speaker: KEOUGH
turns.text: Alright, Ms. Paleontologist.  I wanna know why that monster is here.  You got a theory?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: You said nobody came in here!

turns.speaker: KEOUGH
turns.text: Obviously I was wrong!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Get back from the shore.  We know how fast he can leap out.

turns.speaker: KEOUGH
turns.text: We shouldn't even really be doing this.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: They won't be here till at least noon.  We got a few hours to kill.

turns.speaker: KEOUGH
turns.text: So does he.

turns.speaker: KEOUGH
turns.text: Now I'm gonna puke.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: <u>You</u> <u>gotta</u> <u>be</u> <u>kidding</u>.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Even if we <u>could</u> tranq him-- how would we get him on land.

turns.speaker: KEOUGH
turns.text: Other than to eat us?

turns.speaker: KEOUGH
turns.text: I can't.  I'll get Hector!!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Where is he?!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: If you get a safe shot...

turns.speaker: KEOUGH
turns.text: I'll take it!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Hector.  <u>Do</u> <u>not</u> <u>move</u>.

turns.speaker: KEOUGH
turns.text: He's done.  He's dying.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Don't count on it.  We better take him out.

turns.speaker: KEOUGH
turns.text: Thanks for your help.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: You too.

turns.speaker: KEOUGH
turns.text: He just came up screaming.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: Did he say anything?

turns.speaker: KEOUGH
turns.text: He just kinda gurgled.  He was pretty much dead.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: And you didn't see <u>anything</u>?

turns.speaker: KEOUGH
turns.text: The lake was dead calm until up he came.  The tooth is in there.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: <u>There</u>?  That's the morgue.

turns.speaker: KEOUGH
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: Is the dead guy in there?

turns.speaker: KEOUGH
turns.text: That's where they keep them.  You want me to bring the tooth out here?

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: Um.  No, no.  Let's go.

turns.speaker: KEOUGH
turns.text: I wouldn't.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: I'm fine, thank you.

turns.speaker: KEOUGH
turns.text: Have you ever seen a dead body before, Ms. Scott?

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: Well.  At wakes.

turns.speaker: KEOUGH
turns.text: This is a little different.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: I can look at dead things.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: This... how long did this attack go on for?

turns.speaker: KEOUGH
turns.text: Seconds.  Three, four.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: And this is how he came to the boat?

turns.speaker: KEOUGH
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: Okay.  And is there a place nearby I could go to vomit?

turns.speaker: KEOUGH
turns.text: Nobody lives within twenty-five miles, 'cept some old couple who live right on the lake.  Teenagers trek in every once in a while, none have disappeared, and none have spotted anything unusual.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: You talk to the married couple?

turns.speaker: KEOUGH
turns.text: Not yet.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: What kind of backup do we have?

turns.speaker: KEOUGH
turns.text: <u>We</u>?

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: KEOUGH
turns.text: Sorry.  I'm just a little unclear as to why the Museum of Natural History would send somebody here.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: You have a thing against museums?

turns.speaker: KEOUGH
turns.text: I got nothing against--

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: Ever even been <u>in</u> one?

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: <u>What</u> <u>is</u> <u>that</u>?

turns.speaker: KEOUGH
turns.text: Lightweight Forward Area air device unit.  Whatever's out there, one shot with this and he's dead.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: And you stock these things for what, to fend off Russia?

turns.speaker: KEOUGH
turns.text: You're sort of a rude person.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: It's just that--

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: We don't mean to invade your privacy but... was he ill, was he sick?

turns.speaker: KEOUGH
turns.text: Was he swallowed?

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: Sheriff.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: What is with this lake?  It looks black and... there are no waves or anything.

turns.speaker: KEOUGH
turns.text: They wanted to call it Lake Placid. But somebody said that name was taken.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: Gee.

turns.speaker: KEOUGH
turns.text: The tents were sent ahead, they should already be set-up.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: We're staying in <u>tents</u>?

turns.speaker: KEOUGH
turns.text: I told you.  Two days, we'd have to camp.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: Yes, <u>camp</u>, I thought that meant Holiday Inn, I never heard "tents", will there be toilets?

turns.speaker: KEOUGH
turns.text: What the hell?

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: KEOUGH
turns.text: I thought I saw...

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: It looks like a branch.

turns.speaker: KEOUGH
turns.text: Hey!!

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: You threw it at me!!

turns.speaker: KEOUGH
turns.text: I just let go of it.

turns.speaker: KEOUGH
turns.text: With what?

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: Crocodiles.  He's an expert on them.  And if he's <u>here</u>... then he must think that's what's in this lake.

turns.speaker: KEOUGH
turns.text: They don't believe her.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: Thank you, it's so rewarding to imagine my tax dollar finding its way to you, you Fucker.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: You hurt his feelings.  I think you should go apologize.

turns.speaker: KEOUGH
turns.text: <u>Apologize</u>?

turns.speaker: KEOUGH
turns.text: Is this 'spose to make me take him more serious?

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: It's to make you <u>understand</u> him, with understanding comes tolerance. Too bad they don't put proverbs in Twinkies, my load would be lighter.

turns.speaker: KEOUGH
turns.text: Why does everybody insult my intelligence, I have intelligence, intelligent people eat Twinkies.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: I'm sorry.

turns.speaker: KEOUGH
turns.text: Was that like a homo-sexual remark?

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: I asked you to be nice to him.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: He may be a kook but he's also been all over the world with them.  He even swam in the Grimetti with killer Niles all around him, he never got nipped.

turns.speaker: KEOUGH
turns.text: And that's why he thinks they're Godly?

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: He said he knew it when he looked into their eyes.

turns.speaker: KEOUGH
turns.text: You like Jack?

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: <u>What</u>?  I don't even <u>know</u> the guy.

turns.speaker: KEOUGH
turns.text: Hector thinks you like him.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: Well Hector's a giant cracker.

turns.speaker: KEOUGH
turns.text: You think Jack's handsome?

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: What is this?

turns.speaker: KEOUGH
turns.text: I'm just curious.  I can never tell what women think is handsome.  Is he handsome?

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: Well.  He's probably rugged handsome I guess.  Yeah.

turns.speaker: KEOUGH
turns.text: Hector, Jack, we show you with about twelve minutes of oxygen left, and you're on the last tank. Time to go home.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: <u>That</u> was a bust.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: What was that?

turns.speaker: KEOUGH
turns.text: I don't know.  It was like a tug. Something tugged us.

turns.speaker: KEOUGH
turns.text: Are you alright?

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: I think.  My hair.  Where's Hector?!  Where is he?

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: Hank?

turns.speaker: KEOUGH
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: Are you okay?

turns.speaker: KEOUGH
turns.text: Other than feeling slightly embarrassed, I'm perfectly fine.  Could you cut me down?

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: Hank!

turns.speaker: KEOUGH
turns.text: He said he knew Karate!

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: Shit, shit, shit, shit, shit.

turns.speaker: KEOUGH
turns.text: Look.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: What is she doing <u>now</u>?  <u>Mother</u> <u>of</u> <u>God</u>.

turns.speaker: KEOUGH
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: Look ten feet into the water.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: If he gets close, you go <u>up</u>, Hector, don't you endanger that cow.

turns.speaker: KEOUGH
turns.text: She's worried about the cow now.

turns.speaker: KEOUGH
turns.text: They're coming right in.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: Such a simple idea and it's working.  What does that tell you?

turns.speaker: KEOUGH
turns.text: That it's about to go wrong.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: Did you get him?

turns.speaker: KEOUGH
turns.text: I don't know.  Back the truck--

turns.speaker: KEOUGH
turns.text: Should I?

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: Wait.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: I'm sure this would offend you on principal but... could we keep in touch?

turns.speaker: KEOUGH
turns.text: I guess.

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: Kelly.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: Kevin, hey.

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: Hi.  Listen.  Could I steal you a second?

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: Absolutely.

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: I had a great time last night. Again.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: Me too.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: That's not what you came to say.

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: You work for me.  I'm not comfortable with-- y'know, "us"...

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: I was working for you when "us" started, what's--

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: I know and I thought I could handle it but work and pleasure along with somebody else, it's a dangerous mix.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: Kevin, as long as we...  What was that last part?

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: The somebody else part?

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: Yeah, that part.  There's... somebody who's um...

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: Else.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: Oh.  Oh.  That's okay.  Well.  This uh... this probably wasn't meant to be, y'know.  I mean, I'm... God, I gotta be ten years younger and you, <u>you</u>... you're y'know...

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: A jerk.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: <u>Oh</u>...  No, no, I'm not angry I'm not, I'm just thrown, I'm...  I actually have an early lunch, so...

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: It's ten after nine.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: Yes, well...  famished.

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: Hey.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: Kevin.  How's it going, what's happenin', family good, great, nice to catch up, get out.

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: This is business.  There was an accident in Maine, some guy got killed by something in a lake.  Probably a bear, but... they found a tooth.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: A tooth?

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: A tooth they say couldn't have come from any bear.  They say it looks prehistoric.  Like maybe a dinosaur.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: Oh, well then I'm sure that's it, he got killed by a dinosaur, anything else?

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: I want you to go there.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: Sorry?

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: I'm sure it's nothing, but you're a paleontologist, this is what we do, I--

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: This is what we do?

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: I'd like you to check out this lake.  See--

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: Are you on drugs?

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: Kelly--

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: I'm not going to Maine, I won't even go west of Forty-third Street--

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: Part of our research--

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: I'm not even a field person.

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: Well on this one I'd like you to be.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: This was Myra's idea, wasn't it? Get me out of the office for a few days, until--

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: It has nothing to do with--

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: I never do field work and even if I did, <u>Maine</u>, to look at a tooth of a <u>dinosaur</u> who bit somebody, couldn't you dream up something--

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: <u>Kelly</u>--

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: <u>I</u> <u>am</u> <u>not</u> <u>going</u> <u>to</u> <u>Maine</u>.  That's ridiculous.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: What do you expect, mugging me from behind?

turns.speaker: OKUBO
turns.text: I <u>tapped</u> you.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: Well you <u>shouldn't</u> have.  How did you even know where I was.

turns.speaker: OKUBO
turns.text: Wild guess.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: I don't like to be scared, Myra, I have a thing about fright, don't ever scare me.

turns.speaker: OKUBO
turns.text: Kevin told me you were upset.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: Really?  I never realized he was so psychic, how could he detect that, did he tell you there's somebody else?

turns.speaker: OKUBO
turns.text: Well... he didn't have to tell me that part.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: <u>You</u>?

turns.speaker: OKUBO
turns.text: It started <u>before</u> you, Kelly, I never would've--

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: <u>You</u>?

turns.speaker: OKUBO
turns.text: It was just a quick thing which we thought was over, and and...

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: You and Kevin.

turns.speaker: OKUBO
turns.text: It wasn't suppose to happen, I don't know what to say...

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: You don't know what to say, lucky for you action speaks louder than words.

turns.speaker: OKUBO
turns.text: Kelly--

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: I'm not upset, Myra, okay.  I just never thought of you as a y'know...

turns.speaker: OKUBO
turns.text: Backstabber?

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: OKUBO
turns.text: Liar?

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: Myra.

turns.speaker: OKUBO
turns.text: Shitbutt?

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: I really... I should get back.

turns.speaker: ARDELIA
turns.text: Damn, Clarice, how'd you make me?

turns.speaker: CLARICE
turns.text: Never cock. Just squeeze.

turns.speaker: ARDELIA
turns.text: I love it when you talk dirty.

turns.speaker: CLARICE
turns.text: What'd I do?

turns.speaker: ARDELIA
turns.text: Stay cool. Just remember to call him "God."

turns.speaker: ARDELIA
turns.text: Phone call, Clarice. It's God.

turns.speaker: CLARICE
turns.text: Thanks, Ardelia.

turns.speaker: ARDELIA
turns.text: You missed Fourth Amendment law. Unlawful seizure, real juicy stuff. Where were you all afternoon?

turns.speaker: CLARICE
turns.text: Pleading with a crazy man, with come all over my face.

turns.speaker: CLARICE
turns.text: Boy, is that smart...

turns.speaker: ARDELIA
turns.text: Why does she keep repeating the name?

turns.speaker: CLARICE
turns.text: Somebody's coaching her... They're trying to make him see Catherine as a person - not just an object.

turns.speaker: CLARICE
turns.text: No. He won't come after me.

turns.speaker: ARDELIA
turns.text: Why not?

turns.speaker: CLARICE
turns.text: It would be rude. And he wouldn't get to ask any more questions...

turns.speaker: ARDELIA
turns.text: Clarice - you did the best anybody could have for Catherine Martin. You stuck your neck out for her and you got your butt kicked for her and you tried. It's not your fault it ended this way.

turns.speaker: CLARICE
turns.text: The worst part - the thing that's making me crazy - is that Bill is right in front of me. Only I can't see him...  Lecter said, everything I need to catch him is right here, in these pages...

turns.speaker: ARDELIA
turns.text: Lecter said a lot of things.

turns.speaker: CLARICE
turns.text: He's here, Ardelia.

turns.speaker: CLARICE
turns.text: "Desperately random." What does he mean?

turns.speaker: ARDELIA
turns.text: Not random at all, maybe. Like there's some pattern here...?

turns.speaker: CLARICE
turns.text: But there is no pattern. There's no connection at all among these places, or the computers would've nailed it! They're even found in random order.

turns.speaker: ARDELIA
turns.text: Well, except for the one girl.

turns.speaker: CLARICE
turns.text: What girl?

turns.speaker: ARDELIA
turns.text: The one that was weighted down. Where is she...? Fred something.

turns.speaker: CLARICE
turns.text: Fredrica Bimmel, from Belvedere, Ohio. The first girl taken, but the third body found... Why?

turns.speaker: ARDELIA
turns.text: 'Cause she didn't drift. He weighted her down.

turns.speaker: CLARICE
turns.text: But why? He didn't weight the others.

turns.speaker: CLARICE
turns.text: "- every day."

turns.speaker: ARDELIA
turns.text: Hot damn, Clarice.

turns.speaker: CLARICE
turns.text: He knew her...!

turns.speaker: ARDELIA
turns.text: Agent Starling! Telephone!

turns.speaker: CLARICE
turns.text: Agent Mapp! Thank you!

turns.speaker: BRIGHAM
turns.text: Get your field gear, take stuff for overnight. You're goin' with Crawford.

turns.speaker: CLARICE
turns.text: Where?

turns.speaker: BRIGHAM
turns.text: Some fishermen in West Virginia found an unidentified girl's body. It's a Buffalo Bill-type situation. Been in the water about a week, and Jack needs somebody that can print a floater. Think you can handle it?

turns.speaker: CLARICE
turns.text: I'll need the big fingerprint kit... and the one-to-one Polaroid, the CU- 5, with film packs and batteries.

turns.speaker: BRIGHAM
turns.text: Jack's pretty tough on you, isn't he? Impatient...

turns.speaker: CLARICE
turns.text: Sometimes.

turns.speaker: BRIGHAM
turns.text: He's got a lot on his mind besides Buffalo Bill... His wife, Bella, is real sick. Comatose... I'm tellin' you about it now, 'cause he may never.

turns.speaker: BRIGHAM
turns.text: Wear it, don't ever leave it in your purse. Dry fire it whenever you get the chance. And do your exercises.

turns.speaker: CLARICE
turns.text: I will... I promise.

turns.speaker: BRIGHAM
turns.text: Listen, I hope you never need a thing I've taught you. But you've got something... Jack sees it, I do too. If you ever need to, you can shoot.

turns.speaker: CLARICE
turns.text: FBI, Catherine, you're safe.

turns.speaker: CATHERINE
turns.text: Safe, SHIT, he's got a gun! Getmeout. GET ME OUT!

turns.speaker: CLARICE
turns.text: You're all right! Where is he?

turns.speaker: CATHERINE
turns.text: Get me out!

turns.speaker: CLARICE
turns.text: I'll get you out! Just be quiet so I can hear. Shut that dog up.  Is there a ladder? Is there a rope?

turns.speaker: CATHERINE
turns.text: I don't know! Get me out!!

turns.speaker: CLARICE
turns.text: Catherine. Listen to me. I have to find a rope. I have to leave this room, just for a minute, but -

turns.speaker: CATHERINE
turns.text: NOOOOO! You fucking bitch don't you LEAVE ME down here, DON'T YOU - YOU

turns.speaker: CLARICE
turns.text: Shut UP!  The other officers will be here any minute! you're perfectly safe now!

turns.speaker: CLARICE
turns.text: I'm sure it's a great town, Dr. Chilton, but my instructions are to talk to Lecter and report back this afternoon.

turns.speaker: CHILTON
turns.text: I see.  Let's make this quick, then. I'm busy.

turns.speaker: CHILTON
turns.text: Lecter carved up nine people - that we're sure of - and cooked his favorite bits. We've tried to study him, of course - but he's much too sophisticated for the standard tests. And my, does he hate us! Thinks I'm his nemesis... Crawford's very clever, isn't he? Using you.

turns.speaker: CLARICE
turns.text: How do you mean, Dr. Chilton?

turns.speaker: CHILTON
turns.text: A pretty young woman, to turn him on? I don't believe Lecter's ever seen a woman in eight years. And oh, are you ever his "taste" - so to speak.

turns.speaker: CLARICE
turns.text: I graduated magna from UVA, Doctor. It's not a charm school.

turns.speaker: CHILTON
turns.text: Good. Then you should be able to remember the rules.

turns.speaker: CHILTON
turns.text: Do not reach through the bars, do not touch the bars. You pass him nothing but soft paper - no pens or pencils. No staples or paperclips in his paper. Use the sliding food carrier, no exceptions. Do not accept anything he attempts to hold out to you. Do you understand me?

turns.speaker: CLARICE
turns.text: I understand.

turns.speaker: CHILTON
turns.text: I'm going to show you why we insist on such precautions... On the afternoon of July 8, 1981, he complained of chest pains and was taken to the dispensary. His mouthpiece and restraints were removed for an EKG. When the nurse bent over him, he did this to her...

turns.speaker: CLARICE
turns.text: Dr. Chilton - if Lecter feels you're his enemy - as you've said - then maybe I'll have more luck by myself. What do you think?

turns.speaker: CHILTON
turns.text: You might have suggested that in my office, and saved me the time.

turns.speaker: CLARICE
turns.text: But then I would've missed the pleasure of your company.

turns.speaker: CHILTON
turns.text: What you're doing, Miss Starling, is coming into my hospital to conduct an interview, and refusing to share information with me. For the third time!

turns.speaker: CLARICE
turns.text: Dr. Chilton, I told you - this is just routine follow-up on the Raspail case.

turns.speaker: CHILTON
turns.text: He's my patient! I have rights!  I'm not just some turnkey, Miss Starling. I shouldn't even be here this afternoon. I had a ticket to Holiday on Ice.

turns.speaker: KRENDLER
turns.text: You're out of line, Starling, and you're off this case. Back to Quantico.

turns.speaker: CLARICE
turns.text: Sir, Mr. Crawford instructed me -

turns.speaker: KRENDLER
turns.text: Your instructions are what I'm giving you now. Jack Crawford answers to the Director, and the Director answers to me. My God, Crawford's losing it...! He shouldn't even be on this, with his wife sick as she is... How the hell did you get in here, anyway? He gave you - what? Some kind of special ID? Let's have it.

turns.speaker: CLARICE
turns.text: I need the ID to fly with my gun. The gun belongs in Quantico.

turns.speaker: KRENDLER
turns.text: Gun. Jesus. Turn in the ID as soon as you get back. The gun, too. Be on the next plane, Starling, there's one in 90 minutes.

turns.speaker: CLARICE
turns.text: Mr. Krendler... Dr. Lecter trusts me. Or at least, he used to. If I could just -

turns.speaker: KRENDLER
turns.text: Lecter has already named Buffalo Bill.

turns.speaker: KRENDLER
turns.text: He gave us a perfectly good description, and we're on it now, so we won't be needing your little novelty act any longer - or his, either. He's under close guard at the courthouse, pending a prison transfer. The next plane, Officer.

turns.speaker: CLARICE
turns.text: Sir, doesn't this "William Rubin" strike you as - I don't know - kind of vague?

turns.speaker: KRENDLER
turns.text: Do you need a police escort, Starling? Or do you think you can find the airport by yourself?

turns.speaker: CLARICE
turns.text: Yes sir. I can find it by myself.

turns.speaker: CLARICE
turns.text: Maybe he lives in this, this Belvedere, Ohio, too! Maybe he saw her every day, and killed her sort of spontaneously. Maybe he just meant to... give her a 7-Up and talk about the choir. But then -

turns.speaker: KRENDLER
turns.text: Starling -

turns.speaker: CLARICE
turns.text: But then he had to cover up, make her seem just like all the rest of them. That's what Lecter was hinting!

turns.speaker: KRENDLER
turns.text: The market in Lecter hints is way down, today, okay? I've got two good men dead in Memphis, and three civilians. I've got -

turns.speaker: MR. YOW
turns.text: Not to my knowledge. Privacy is a great concern to my customers. But, if you say this is an FBI matter...

turns.speaker: CLARICE
turns.text: I won't disturb anything, Mr. Yow, I promise. Be gone before you know it.

turns.speaker: CLARICE
turns.text: Mr. Yow, if this door should fall down -ha ha! - or anything else - would you be kind enough to call this number? It's our Baltimore field office. They know you're here with me... Do you understand?

turns.speaker: MR. YOW
turns.text: Might I suggest tucking your pants into your socks? To prevent mouse intrusion.

turns.speaker: CLARICE
turns.text: Good idea.

turns.speaker: MR. YOW
turns.text: Okay, Miss Starling?

turns.speaker: CLARICE
turns.text: Okay, Mr. Yow...

turns.speaker: MR. YOW
turns.text: You're playing a piano, Miss Starling?

turns.speaker: CLARICE
turns.text: That wasn't me.

turns.speaker: MR. YOW
turns.text: Oh.

turns.speaker: CLARICE
turns.text: Mr. Yow? Oh Mr. Yow...? It looks like somebody is sitting in this car.

turns.speaker: MR. YOW
turns.text: Oh my! Oh my... Maybe you better come out now, Miss Starling.

turns.speaker: CLARICE
turns.text: Not yet! - just wait for me.  Maybe in about two seconds.

turns.speaker: CLARICE
turns.text: Excuse me, but I really do need to talk to you. This was Mrs. Lippman's house. Did you know her?

turns.speaker: MR. GUMB
turns.text: Just briefly. What's the problem, Officer?

turns.speaker: CLARICE
turns.text: I'm investigating the death of Fredrica Bimmel. Who are you, please?

turns.speaker: MR. GUMB
turns.text: Jack Gordon.

turns.speaker: CLARICE
turns.text: Mr. Gordon, did you know Fredrica when she worked for Mrs. Lippman?

turns.speaker: MR. GUMB
turns.text: No. Wait... Was she a great, fat person? I may have seen her, I'm not sure...

turns.speaker: MR. GUMB
turns.text: Mrs. Lippman had a son, maybe he could help you. I have his card somewhere. Do you mind stepping inside, while I looks for it?

turns.speaker: CLARICE
turns.text: Thanks.

turns.speaker: MR. GUMB
turns.text: Are they close to catching somebody, do you think?

turns.speaker: CLARICE
turns.text: I think we may be, yes.

turns.speaker: CLARICE
turns.text: Mr. Gordon, did you take over this place after Mrs. Lippman died?

turns.speaker: MR. GUMB
turns.text: Yes. I bought the house from her, two years ago.

turns.speaker: CLARICE
turns.text: Did she leave any records here? Tax or business records? Maybe a list of employees?
